H0.text: The heat comes from the Sun is the source of the heat released during the eruption of Mount Arenal, a volcano in Costa Rica.

H1.text: The heat comes from pools of underground water during the eruption of Mount Arenal, a volcano in Costa Rica.

H2.text: The heat comes from deep within Earth during the eruption of Mount Arenal, a volcano in Costa Rica, when heat is released.

H3.text: The heat comes from decaying plants and animals is the source of the heat released during the eruption of Mount Arenal, a volcano in Costa Rica.

A4.text: The study also suggested that while Arenal is currently dormant, future activity is likely due to its persistent magmatic supply.

A5.text: the presence of fumaroles was reported at the summit.
